intro: Lepanthes pelvis, commonly known as the "pelvis orchid," is a species of orchid native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, often fragrant flowers. The plant typically grows as an epiphyte, attaching itself to trees in humid tropical forests. Its leaves are usually dark green and leathery, adapted to retain moisture in its natural habitat. The flowers, which can be white, yellow, or orange, are known for their intricate structure and ornamental value.
